meanings.definition: A grassy plain in tropical and subtropical regions, with few trees.
meanings.sent1: The savanna stretched out endlessly, covered in tall grasses.
meanings.sent2: The elephants roamed freely across the vast savanna.
meanings.sent3: The lion decided to have a picnic in the savanna, surrounded by greenery.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a savanna of ideas, with only a few trees of inspiration scattered around.
meanings.sent5: The savanna shimmered under the hot sun, a sea of grass as far as the eye could see.

meanings.definition: A type of ecosystem characterized by grasslands with scattered trees.
meanings.sent1: The savanna ecosystem supported a diverse range of wildlife.
meanings.sent2: The giraffes gracefully moved through the savanna, nibbling on leaves.
meanings.sent3: The monkeys threw a party in the savanna, swinging from tree to tree.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a savanna of emotions, with scattered trees of happiness and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The savanna whispered secrets of the ancient trees, their stories carried by the wind.
